goal.core.runtime.service.agent

Class AgentService<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.runtime.service.agent.AgentService<D,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - The debugger type
    C - The interpreter type

    public class AgentService<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class keeps track of agents in the system and creating new local agents when a new entity appears.

    This class must be thread safe.

      • getAgents

        Returns:
        a set of all agents

      • getAgent

        public Agent<C> getAgent(AgentId id)
        Returns the GOAL agent with name agentName, if it runs locally.
        Parameters:
        id - the agent to be found.
        Returns:
        GOAL agent with name agentName, or null if a GOAL agent with that name does not exist locally on THIS JVM.

      • getAliveAgents

        public java.util.List<Agent<C>> getAliveAgents()
        Returns all local agents that are running. This collection is thread-safe.
        Returns:
        all local agents that are running.

      • getDeadAgents

        public java.util.List<Agent<C>> getDeadAgents()
        Returns all local agents that are dead. This collection is thread-safe.
        Returns:
        all local agents that are dead.

      • hasAliveLocalAgents

        public boolean hasAliveLocalAgents()
        Returns:
        True if there are any running local agents.

      • hasLocalAgents

        public boolean hasLocalAgents()
        Returns:
        True if there are any local agents (running or not).

      • stopAgent

        public void stopAgent(AgentId id)
        Stop an agent.
        Parameters:
        id - The agent to stop.

      • handleAgentCreated

        public void handleAgentCreated(AgentId id)
        This is called by remote Runtime when it is notified that a new agent has been created. It can be remote or local agent. All local agents are notified of the new agent.
        Parameters:
        id - of the created message box.

      • handleAgentRemoved

        public void handleAgentRemoved(AgentId id)
        If the agent was a local agent it is removed and the observers are notified. Note that agents only remove their message box if PMPreferences.getRemoveKilledAgent() is true.
        Parameters:
        id - of the created message box.

      • handleEnvironmentEvent

        public boolean handleEnvironmentEvent(EnvironmentEvent event,
                             EnvironmentPort receiver)
        Handles environment events routed via MonitoringService. FIXME
        Parameters:
        event - The environment event
        receiver - The port to route the event to
        Returns:
        True if the event was handled; false otherwise

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal(AgentId id)
        Returns true if the agent id belongs to an agent that is running on this system.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the agent to check
        Returns:
        true if the agent id belongs to a local agent

      • awaitFirstAgent

        public boolean awaitFirstAgent(long timeout,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Await the launch of the first agent. This method will return once an agent has been launched.
        Parameters:
        timeout -
        timeUnit -
        Returns:
        True when any agent has launched within the timeout.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • awaitFirstAgent

        public boolean awaitFirstAgent()
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Await the launch of the first agent. This method will return once an agent has been launched.
        Returns:
        true if agents are present
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
